title: Gareth Southgate showed England stars his Euro 96 penalty miss as part of rousing speech
text:

Gareth Southgate showed his heartbreaking penalty miss at Euro 96 to his England players as part of a rousing speech prior to the Three Lions' clash in Germany on Wednesday evening. 
Southgate's miss proved fatal to England's hopes of securing their first tournament win for 30 years as they crashed out at the semi-final stage to the Germans at Wembley. 
And Leicester striker Jamie Vardy revealed a clip of the infamous spot kick was part of Southgate's motivational chat with his stars. 
“The penalty was on there, yes," Vardy said. "Yes it was. Andreas Kopke saves Southgate's penalty at Wembley (Photo: Getty) Southgate gave a rousing speech to his players prior to their match against Germany (Photo: PA) Vardy revealed Southgate used the clip (Photo: Getty) 
"He didn’t go into much detail but he wanted it to be on there to show how far he has come as well. Obviously him being in that situation to have his knowledge of that can benefit us quite a lot.” 
Southampton’s new call-up James Ward-Prowse added: “It was a very powerful message. I think obviously we want to be the best in the world. 
“We want to establish ourselves as a top team in the world. So it is all about plugging away at those goals and making sure that what we do now stands us in good stead for when we reach major tournaments." 
Southgate invited 10 additional players not named in the England squad to attend the meeting - but only Stoke keeper Jack Butland turned up. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
